alert.note: Alert for Dent; Phelps (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 07 at 8:40PM CDT until August 08 at 12:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT CDT TONIGHT FOR EAST CENTRAL PHELPS AND NORTHWESTERN DENT COUNTIES... At 840 PM CDT, Trained weather spotters and the Lenox Fire Department reported flooding over northwest Dent County along Hyer Branch and Horse Creek. Between 1 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. The rain has ended, however, residual flooding over northwest Dent County and eastern Phelps County is possible over the next few hours along Hyer Branch and Dry Fork Creek. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lake Spring and Anutt. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
